page.title: 01 The Harrowdens.
page.content: The Harrowdens as they are known locally include the villages of Little and Great Harrowden.They are about five kilometres outside the town of Wellingbrough surrounded by open countryside. The land is mainly agricultural farmland and much is used for the growing of cereal crops.However some of the fields do have cattle and sheep grazing in them. Most of the people living in the villages travel outside the village to work.Wheatabix at Burton Latimer employs people from the Harrowdens and provides transport to and from work. There is a shoe factory in Little Harrowden that employs people from the village.When asked about the bus service many people said that it could not be relied upon.
